result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin E Eith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, AODA treatment, child care, work crew.
No drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, AODA treatment, child care, work crew.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/1/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
By stipulation of the parties, Court amends the language in the information to reflect "without a valid prescription" and changes "oxycontin" to "oxycodone".

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Matter set for plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Marissa Santiago for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed. Letter Kershek Law Office dated 3/2/15.
HMP

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant retained counsel however, Attorney Kershek was unable to appear due to scheduling conflict. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court. David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant wishes to retain private counsel. Court informed the defendant that counsel would need to be present on the next date. Case calendared for PRELIMINARY HEARING on 3/5/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM007099  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-10-2015

Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any drugs without a valid prescription.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered remaining bail ($400.00) to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Benjamin E Eith in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
